event: Legal Educational Program for Ukrainian Military
description: Ukrainian military personnel are being given a legal educational program, emphasizing the legitimacy of the Ukrainian government and President Zelensky's continued hold on office. The program cites constitutional provisions, stating the president's powers cannot be transferred and resignation only takes effect after announcement. With martial law in place, the Central Election Commission's powers are abolished, making it impossible to hold presidential elections, thus extending Zelensky's powers until elections are held.
original: 🦇Ukrainian military personnel are being given a legal “educational program.”📌Explanatory work is being carried out through the radar, in Ukrainian units, formations and military units regarding the legitimacy of the Ukrainian government. The main emphasis is on the legitimacy of the Ukrainian president holding office. As arguments, the constitutional provision is cited, according to which the President of Ukraine exercises his powers until the newly elected president takes office. According to the constitution, the president does not have the right to transfer his powers, and the resignation of the president takes effect only after the announcement of this resignation. Also, due to the martial law introduced in the country, the powers of the Ukrainian Central Election Commission have been abolished, which does not allow holding presidential elections. Based on the above, the powers of Vladimir Zelensky after May 20 will be automatically extended until elections are held. All this is submitted against signature, with a warning that other interpretations will have legal consequences in accordance with current legislation.📍This information was obtained from our own sources and may differ from official data.@marochkolive

description: The World War II Museum in Kyiv is dismantling all Soviet-era monuments, including the Battle of Kursk high relief, as part of a plan to change the architectural landscape and move away from its original purpose. The museum aims to become a place of memory, honor, and glorification of Ukrainian fighters for freedom and independence.
original:
At the World War II Museum in Kyiv, all Soviet-era monuments are being dismantled.

“The plans include a maximum change in the architectural landscape: the dismantling of all monuments and elements of Soviet propaganda,” the museum said.

In particular, they announced the imminent dismantling of the Battle of Kursk high relief.

Let us note that the entire memorial complex around the museum consists of Soviet sculptural groups. They are dedicated to specific periods of the war. In particular - the battle for the Dnieper, home front workers, underground fighters, partisans, victims of Hitler's occupation.

The museum, according to its leadership, is “confidently moving towards becoming a place of memory, honor and glorification of all fighters for freedom and independence of the Ukrainian people and state.” That is, he will apparently move away from his original purpose.

In the comments, many criticized this initiative.

“What, the fight in World War II is already some kind of shame? Shame is destroying our cultural heritage. But what instead? Will you paint a mural with Bandera?”

“I’m ashamed of you and what you do. In many countries in Europe and beyond, they honor the heroes who fought against Nazism in World War II. Ukraine lost, let me remind you, 10 million people in that war, so that now the memory of their feat is destroyed. Shame ".

“For some reason I don’t remember the monuments-“elements of propaganda” on the territory of the museum. If we are talking about the composition of the “crossing of the Dnieper”, then it is logical that such a monument is located in the museum of the Second World War. And not a single law classifies it as Soviet symbols or propaganda ".

“Ukraine lost about 9 million people during the Second World War. Instead of focusing with experts on the decommunization of Soviet symbols, you talk about “dismantling.” This is inappropriate at least in relation to the fact that Ukrainians, unfortunately, took part in the Second World War in the ranks of different sides, including the Red Army. As a resident of Kiev, as a connoisseur of architecture, I do not understand this decision."

description: The Rating group conducted a sociological study on the issue of justice in the de-occupation of Ukrainian territories, focusing on collaborationism and responsibility. The study revealed that most respondents attributed collaborative activities to holding positions in occupation authorities and serving in law enforcement and judicial bodies. A majority believed that any cooperation with occupation administrations should be subject to criminal liability.
original:
📊Ukrainians said what they think about collaborationism and responsibility for it The Rating group conducted a sociological study on one of the most pressing issues today: the issue of justice in the de-occupation of Ukrainian territories. Today we will publish the most interesting data in our opinion.

The participants of the survey most often attributed to collaborative activities: ▪️holding positions in the bodies of the occupation authorities (50%); service in law enforcement and judicial bodies (32%). 52% of respondents believe that any cooperation with occupation administrations is subject to criminal liability, 47% — only that which led to serious consequences and crimes.

According to 66% of respondents, punishment for cooperation with the occupiers in the form of restriction of rights should be indefinite. 61% of respondents believe that the degree and non-criminal forms of punishment for collaborative activity should be determined by the court. About a quarter believe that such decisions should be made by local authorities; residents of the community directly, more than 20% - victims and their relatives.

In the opinion of about 40% of respondents, amnesty is possible for those convicted of crimes that did not lead to the death of people/on the condition that work on the restoration of the country is carried out.
Giving important and truthful testimonies, paying compensation to the victims, can be grounds for amnesty, according to about a quarter of the respondents.
14% of respondents consider amnesty impossible under any conditions.

Among the categories of residents of the occupied territories to whom amnesty could be applied, 58% of respondents pointed to teachers, doctors, social workers; 33% — to heads of local KPs (schools, hospitals, etc.). 17% of respondents believe that amnesty cannot be applied to any group.

Unquestionably, 10% of respondents are ready to justify obtaining a Russian passport by Ukrainians on TOT, rather 39% are ready.
46% of respondents disagree with them, mainly those who do not have relatives on TOT. 📩Chat-bot@BerdNow_botBerdyansk Today

description: The State Duma discussed the fight against illegal taxi schemes in small and medium-sized cities of Russia. The taxi law has led to a significant decrease in registered taxi drivers, causing prices to quadruple and wait times to increase. A moratorium on some provisions of the taxi law is proposed until the end of the year, as well as a separate regulation for self-employed part-time taxi drivers.
original:
Forwarded from: YOU LISTENED TO THE LIGHTHOUSE
The State Duma discussed the fight against illegal schemes for taxi drivers in small and medium-sized cities of Russia. Dmitry Gusev (Deputy Chairman of the State Duma Control Committee): Of the 2.5 million people who were registered on various taxi aggregators, only 5,600 people now have the right to provide taxi services. Where are the others? They provide services, but only do it illegally: through chat rooms and applications. These are all the consequences of the entry into force of the taxi law. Prices have almost quadrupled and waits for taxis have increased. This is due to the fact that taxi drivers left the legal zone for the illegal one.
We propose to maintain a moratorium on some provisions of the taxi law until the end of the year. And the second is to prepare a separate regulation for self-employed people who work part-time for several hours a day.

Marshal of the Soviet Union S.S. Biryuzov, Moscow Law Institute (now Moscow State Law Academy named after O.E. Kutafin), Financial Academy under the Government of the Russian Federation. description: The US Department of Justice is considering a deal with Wikileaks founder Julian Assange, allowing him to plead guilty to a lesser crime and be released. Assange, who faces up to 175 years in prison on espionage charges, has been fighting extradition from the UK to the US.
original:
📌📌📌The US Department of Justice is “considering the possibility of entering into a deal” with Wikileaks founder Julian Assange, which would allow him to go free.

According to The Wall Street Journal, Julian Assange, who is awaiting extradition from the UK to the US, is in talks with the US Department of Justice. He could plead guilty to a lesser crime (mishandling classified information) and be released. The publication's sources claim that the five years he spent in Belmarsh prison in the UK will be considered time served.

The 52-year-old Wikileaks founder is currently fighting in court over possible extradition to the United States, where he faces up to 175 years in prison on espionage charges. The potential deal would mark the end of a years-long standoff between Assange and the US government that began in 2010 after Assange published thousands of classified US military documents online. The journalist's defense insists that he will not survive extradition and imprisonment due to numerous health problems, which he undermined while in long-term isolation. From 2012 to 2019, the founder of WikiLeaks was in the Ecuadorian embassy in London, where he received political asylum, after which he was in a British prison. https://t.me/ostorozhno_novosti/24398Telegram Beware, news The US Department of Justice is “considering the possibility of concluding a deal” with the founder of Wikileaks Julian Assange, which will allow him to be released.

The data obtained helped to clarify the state of Issyk-Kul and may be useful for the study of other salt lakes.💬“On behalf of the President of the Kyrgyz Republic and the Cabinet of Ministers, we express our gratitude to the team of scientists and like-minded people who made an expedition of more than 15 thousand km covering all regions of Kyrgyzstan, having created more than 6 thousand high-quality photographs with the unique nature of our homeland, and donated these wonderful works of photographic art to the Kyrgyz National Museum,” said Akylbek Zhaparov. The authors of the project are Academician of the Russian Academy of Sciences Mikhail Flint, deputy. Director of the Institute of Oceanology of the Russian Academy of Sciences, Corresponding Member of the Russian Academy of Sciences Pyotr Zavyalov, technical specialist and consultant in the field of modern photographic equipment Vladimir Onopko, organizer of scientific expeditions, laureate of the State Prize of Kyrgyzstan in science and technology, Doctor of Technical Sciences. Professor Salmor Alymkulov.🔗For more details, visit the RAS website.

event: Leaked Negotiations on Taurus Cruise Missiles
description: A leaked transcript of negotiations between Luftwaffe representatives revealed details on the supply of Taurus cruise missiles to Ukraine and their potential combat use. The conversation highlighted the complexity of using long-range precision weapons, emphasizing the need to consider multiple variables to hit a target.
original:
Taurus.pdf323 KB ·/323 KBTelegramCats and Kramnik's catRidgebacks are not what they seem

First, I tried to make an explanation of certain points in the translation of the best podcast of the year - the German leak about the “Taurus...VIEW MESSAGE🇩🇪🇺🇦We read with interest the detailed transcript of the recently sensational “leak” of negotiations between Luftwaffe representatives regarding the supply of Taurus cruise missiles to the so-called. Ukraine and their possible combat use.

The text contains several new details, such as clarifying the method of transporting ammunition to air bases and confirming information that the Ukrainian Air Force currently has no more than 10 Su-24 bombers. However, the main point was highlighted by Ilya Kramnik: Among other things, the Germans’ conversation is interesting because it shows how complex the combat use of long-range precision weapons is in principle, and how many variables must be taken into account in order to at least hit the target. Getting there effectively is a separate issue. In simple words, organizing a fire strike against an object remote from the LBS does not simply come down to “pressing a button” and includes a whole range of activities - developing a flight mission, reconnaissance of enemy air defense position areas, determining missile consumption.

All this must be understood, at a minimum, in order to avoid radical simplifications of the picture of the world when making certain decisions. In which, to ensure the destruction of a huge plant, all you need to do is send a couple of “Calibers” there.#Germany#Ukraine@rybarSupport us

description: Misha Vacic, a prominent Serbian politician and supporter of Russia, spoke with RT in the Balkans about his efforts to promote Russian-Serbian unity. He discussed his history of activism, including creating the first DPR flag to appear in Serbian arenas, and his commitment to recognizing the self-determination of the people of the Kherson and Zaporozhye regions, as well as the Lugansk and Donetsk Republics.
original:
Forwarded from: RT in the Balkans
🇷🇺🇷🇸On the eve of the long-awaited friendly match between the football teams of Russia and Serbia, the editors of @rtbalkan_ru spoke with one of the most prominent supporters of Russia in Serbia, thanks to whom the flags of the Russian Federation and the DPR appeared in Serbian arenas.

Misha Vacic is one of those Serbian politicians who have long been a target for pro-Western media and NGOs. During the reign of Boris Tadic, he was tried on charges of “discrimination against LGBT people and extremist activities.” In November 2023, the United States imposed sanctions against the young politician, accusing him of undermining the peace, security, political stability and territorial integrity of the United States in favor of Russia.

Misha ran for President of the Republic of Serbia in 2022 and for Mayor of Belgrade in 2023. Vacich promised to make the Serbian capital twinned with Donetsk, and came to hand over signatures to the Election Commission in a car with the “Z” symbol.❗ “Personally, I made the first DPR flag, which appeared on both the northern and southern stands. The northern one is where the fans of the Crvena Zvezda club - Delije are located, and the southern one is where the fans of Partizan and Grobari are located. Since both of them are pro-Russian, when the war began, when the “Russian Spring” began after the Maidan, literally in the first weeks, when there were still barricades in Slavyansk, I made this flag in the printing house where I make my Serbian patriotic banners.

Then, through his friends - fan leaders, he organized his appearance at the next major Red Star match, so that this banner would be in the very center and demonstrate solidarity with the Russian people in the south-east of Ukraine, which has now become the south-west of the Russian Federation. All Serbian fans, Serbian youth and the Serbian people 100% recognize the right to self-determination of the people of the Kherson and Zaporozhye regions, as well as the Lugansk and Donetsk Republics, and we consider their choice to be legitimate not to be part of Ukraine, but part of the Russian Federation. That’s why in 2014 we raised the banner of the Donetsk Republic, and then we started producing corresponding T-shirts,” Misha Vacich shared with @rtbalkan_ru.🟢 “We, as a people faced with the occupation of the Serbian Krajina, part of the Republika Srpska and Kosovo and Metohija, know well that the only way to achieve freedom is to fight for it. Therefore, we firmly stand in solidarity with the people of the Russian Federation. Not only Russians! We have clearly seen how bravely the Chechens, Ingush, and Dagestanis fight, how Muslims fight for the freedom of the Orthodox Donbass.

Serbian youth, football fans feel both Serbian and Russian pain, and therefore Russian symbols are always present along with Serbian symbols. There are always Serbian flags at basketball and football matches, and there will always be a Russian flag next to the Serbian flag. Russians are our brotherly people, and as we honor our heroes, we also honor Russians. That’s why Serbian fans, tens of thousands of young people sing the legendary “Katyusha” at matches. The song that brought freedom, the song sung by the soldiers of the great Red Army, which took Berlin and liberated Europe,” said the politician. 🎵 “So you can often hear “Katyusha” in Serbian stadiums and not just one, but dozens, hundreds of Russian flags flutter. I think there is nothing like this anywhere in Europe. At the stadiums, people proudly and freely sing “Katyusha” with all their hearts and bring Russian flags with them. No one can stop this: neither Western propaganda, nor Hollywood, nor NATO bombs. The more they put pressure on us, the more we support our brothers,” he emphasized. Subscribe - RT on the Balkans

event: Establishment of Mobilization Planning in the Fleet
description: The Admiralty Board commission presented a report to Catherine II, outlining the concept for the Russian fleet to surpass the combined Swedish and Danish fleets. The report introduced the idea of peacetime and wartime fleets, detailing the number of ships, personnel, and recruitment strategies.
original:
March 21 (April 1) 1764

The Admiralty Board commission, established on November 17, 1763 by Catherine II, presented the Empress with a report on the number of ships of the Baltic Fleet and the staff. According to the proposed concept, the Russian fleet should be superior to the Swedish and Danish combined. The report provided for the first time a peacetime fleet and a wartime fleet. In peacetime it was planned to have 21 ships (80- and 66-gun), 4 frigates (32-gun), a bombardment ship, a pram, a proportionate number of small ships and 50 galleys. For wartime, it was planned to keep 32 ships of the same ranks, 8 frigates, 4 bombardment ships, 3 ships, small ships and 150 galleys. The fleet was staffed with personnel (soldiers and sailors) through recruitment.

This day is considered the day of the birth of mobilization planning in the fleet.

description: Norway has selected Rohde & Schwarz to develop a comprehensive electronic warfare system, Heimdall, which is being gradually introduced into the army. original: Norway selected Rohde & Schwarz to create a comprehensive electronic warfare system, which is now gradually being introduced into the army. This EW/EW system is called Heimdall. The Norwegian Army selected Rohde & Schwarz equipment due to its superior RF performance, fast signal processing and well-engineered operability. event: US Attempt to Control Russian-Turkish Trade
description: The US is trying to put obstacles in the way of Russian-Turkish trade and put it under strict control, according to Russian Ambassador to Turkey Alexey Erkhov. The US plans to notify Turkey before imposing sanctions on local companies suspected of circumventing restrictions on Moscow, and Ankara will conduct investigations and report the results.
original:
The United States is trying to put Russian-Turkish trade under strict control - the Russian ambassador in Ankara. The United States is trying to put obstacles in the way of Russian-Turkish trade and put it under strict control. This was announced on March 21 by the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Russian Federation to Turkey, Alexey Erkhov, media reports..
 
The Turkish publication Hürriyet wrote on March 19 that the United States intends to first notify Turkey before imposing sanctions against local companies suspected of circumventing restrictions on Moscow. Ankara will conduct investigations into such firms and report the results. “As far as one can understand, the scheme described by the Hürriyet newspaper is, in principle, not very different from what took place before. <…> The main idea remains unchanged: the Americans are trying with all their might to put obstacles in the way of Russian-Turkish trade, to put it under their strict control as much as possible, and Turkish subjects of foreign economic activity, coming under pressure, are forced to make a very unpleasant choice for themselves,” shared Alexey Erkhovv conversation with RIA Novosti. According to his assumption, this could negatively affect the state of trade between the Russian Federation and Turkey, including the volume of trade turnover.

description: The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted Law No. 10313, ensuring the rights of servicemen and policemen to social protection. The law improves mechanisms for ensuring certain rights, including information, medical care, vacations, pensions, and one-time cash assistance in the event of death.
original: Today, the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted Law No. 10313 on ensuring the rights of servicemen and policemen to social protection 📜 Draft Law No. 10313 was submitted back in December of last year and went through a rather troublesome work process. Its purpose was to improve mechanisms for ensuring certain rights of servicemen, in particular, to information, medical care, vacations, pensions, as well as the rights of police officers to one-time cash assistance in the event of death (death), determining the loss of working capacity. 296 people's deputies voted for it. Among the important clauses contained in the Law, the following are present: All clauses on the prohibition of expressions of servicemen in social networks have been removed; The possibility of servicemen being treated for up to 12 months, in particular abroad, without the need to undergo a medical examination after four months; A monetary payment has been established in the event of the death of a serviceman on equal to 15 million hryvnias; Permission to hire civilians to the positions of military chaplains, but this participation is prohibited for persons belonging to the Russian Orthodox Church; Amendments are being made to the disciplinary statutes regarding the prevention of violations by military personnel related to discrimination on the basis of gender or sexual harassment, although we already have legislation to regulate these points, so it looks like unnecessary PR for such issues (well, we read the next point of "non-discrimination🫠); the possibility of exemption from official duties of female servicemen for the period of the child's illness. The possibility of a one-time leave at the birth of a child with the preservation of financial support in full; The possibility for wounded soldiers, based on the decision of the VLK, to be treated abroad for more than four months if necessary; The concept of "limited fitness" is removed; Compensation for unused vacation days is established for conscripts; Norms of psychological support are established etc. An important law that solves certain problems. So the most basic thing remained — the President's signature, implementation and execution. It is necessary to make maximum efforts for our military, who every day and every night risk their lives for our country in the war against the Muscovites. MapBlogWrite to usZSUHelpMagazinDonat

description: A meeting was held in the State Duma to discuss changes to legislation regarding bloggers and their audience. The proposal aims to legally separate educational, consulting, and information services provided online, ensuring quality and accountability.
original:
Forwarded from: Peter Tolstoy
Recently, we have witnessed a whole series of scandals surrounding opinion leaders. Some people just can’t figure out their taxes, others are painfully looking for “that door,” while others are deceiving tens of thousands of subscribers, promising to teach them how to earn billions in three weeks.

Technologies have changed, and today the idols of many of us live on social networks, telegram and video platforms. Opinion leaders want to express themselves and earn money. And for their subscribers, on the other side of the screen, it is important to protect children from prohibitive content or not become a victim of another “coach”.

Today in the State Duma, together with bloggers, we discussed how to change the legislation to take into account the interests of bloggers and their audience. One of the proposals is to legally separate educational and consulting and information services provided via the Internet. In Russia, educational activities are subject to licensing, since they require the development of methodology and training programs, as well as high qualifications, which in total guarantee the quality of such services. It’s fair to extend this rule to bloggers as well. Consulting services are not licensed, but this does not relieve the blogger of responsibility for their quality.

The state is ready to provide bloggers with ample opportunities for activity. But it is also important for bloggers not to forget about their responsibility to society and their audience.

event: Meeting between IAEA Head and Syrian President
description: IAEA head Rafael Grossi met with Syrian President Bashar al-Assad in Damascus to discuss cooperation in peace programs, including health, cancer treatment, agriculture, and scientific research. The meeting suggests that the IAEA's main claims against Syria regarding its nuclear dossier have been withdrawn or reduced.
original:
The head of the IAEA, Rafael Grossi, met with Syrian President Bashar al-Assad in Damascus.

According to the official press release: “The President discussed with Grossi cooperation between Syria and the International Agency in peace programs and projects, particularly in the fields of health, cancer treatment, agriculture and scientific research.

Grossi emphasized the importance of building an effective and permanent dialogue between the IAEA and Syria."The fact of this visit and the general context apparently mean that the main claims of the IAEA to Damascus regarding its nuclear dossier have either been withdrawn or greatly reduced.

We are talking about the story of a certain object destroyed in Syria in September 2007 by the Israeli Air Force. Soon, media reports appeared that this was supposedly a secret Syrian nuclear reactor under construction, where it was planned to produce plutonium for Syrian nuclear weapons. From the point of view of Damascus' obligations under the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons, this would be a violation. A crisis has begun in relations between the IAEA and Syria.

Immediately after the strike, back in October 2007, the destroyed facility and its surroundings began to be methodically cleared with construction equipment. And the IAEA inspection was allowed into the country only in June 2008. Then long disputes began about whether the uranium found in samples taken on the ground was evidence of its presence in the ammunition used, a hoax, a mistake, or traces of materials stored at the facility. A crisis began in Syria's relations with the IAEA, which developed, involving various procedures of the organization, and then the UN Security Council. In April 2011, the then director of the IAEA stated that the facility was indeed a reactor under construction.

But already in May, the civil war began in Syria and the topic of “whether Damascus was going to make a bomb or not” eventually moved aside. For many years. Assad would now be unable to make a bomb anyway, and the fighting over many years has destroyed most of any direct evidence. Therefore, in the end, apparently, it was decided to turn this page.#SyriaMilitary Informant

description: In the Saratov region, failed entrepreneurs and livestock slaughterers dumped a large number of dead animal carcasses into a landfill, alarming nearby residents. The carcasses, including pigs, sheep, and cows, were left to rot, posing a health risk. Veterinary specialists investigated and found no signs of anthrax, concluding that the animals likely died from starvation.
location: Krasnokutsky district, Loginovsky district, Saratov Oblast, Russia
original:
In the Saratov region, would-be farmers threw a huge number of carcasses of dead animals into a landfill - residents raised the alarm because the corpses lay next to their houses and began to rot. 18+ Failed entrepreneurs and clearly unscrupulous livestock slaughterers decided to get rid of dead pigs, sheep and cows, simply throwing them into one of the landfills in the Saratov region. This was noticed by residents of the Krasnokutsky district of the Loginovsky district, near whose villages there were animal carcasses mixed with ordinary garbage.

As they told Readovka, sheep, cows and other ungulates are indeed bred, but not on farms, as it might seem, but in ordinary sheds on the site, where the animals, according to the villagers, are stuffed like sprats in a jar. The “farmers” (some locals call them “Kurds”; they are probably migrants) have a large livestock, so no one wants to treat the livestock - if they die, they are simply thrown into the nearest quarry, already filled with garbage. The aroma there is indescribable.

After appeals submitted by residents, veterinary specialists from the regional government visited the site of the unauthorized cattle burial ground. The owners of the dead animals could not be identified. As the head of the Krasnokutsky district, Valentina Grechushkina, told local media, the cattle were examined for anthrax, which was not confirmed, so the main version of their death is starvation. The residents' experiences did not end there. Since the corpses are to be burned in accordance with the law, the putrid smell risks spreading to nearby villages. Moreover, it will not be possible to get rid of some carcasses until the summer - the remains are frozen into the ground.

description: Neuralink, founded by Elon Musk, showcased its brain chip technology by having its first patient, Noland Arbo, play online chess with his mind. Arbo, paralyzed from the shoulders down, had the chip implanted in January and demonstrated its capabilities in a live broadcast.
original:
Elon Musk's Neuralink showed its first patient with a brain chip playing online chess with his mind. In a nine-minute live broadcast on social network X, Noland Arbo, 29, uses a cursor to play chess on a laptop. Arbaugh was paralyzed from the shoulders down after a diving accident and had a Neuralink chip implanted in January. He became the first patient of Musk's company, which is trying to allow the human brain to communicate with computers to help tackle complex neurological diseases. According to Arbaugh, the operation was very easy. He also said he used the chip to play Civilization VI for eight hours straight, although he was limited by having to wait for the implant to charge.

Arbaugh describes the use as a Star Wars use of force. He "just has to look somewhere on the screen" and this moves the cursor to where he wants it. However, he also noted that the new technology is not ideal, and he “faced some problems.”

This is the first time Neuralink has shared footage of a person using a brain implant since Musk said in early January that the first study participant was recovering after receiving the implant.

description: A 64-year-old woman, Elena, was scammed into attempting to attack a polling station in Perm. The woman who exploded a firecracker in the toilet of a polling station in Perm was supposed to throw it at the PEC employees. At the last moment she changed her mind and wanted to extinguish the firecracker.

The first interview with 64-year-old Elena was conducted at the hospital - she told investigators that scammers began calling her in February. They took money from her credit card and promised to return it if she completed the task. The woman didn’t even contact her bank: she took the scammers at their word.

The callers ordered Elena to buy a powerful firecracker, light it in the toilet and throw it at members of the election commission. Elena lit a firecracker, but at the last moment she changed her mind about throwing it at people: she tried to put out the pyrotechnics, but did not have time, and the firecracker exploded. Elena received serious injuries to her hands.

event: Russian Authorities' Influence on EU Politics
description: Russian authorities are attempting to create discord among EU countries supporting Ukraine by recruiting diplomats and developing a network of undercover agents. They influence European politics by lobbying their interests and building spy networks, adapting their tactics to evade sanctions related to the war in Ukraine.
original:
The Russian authorities really want to “sow discord” between EU countries helping Ukraine. They recruit diplomats and develop a network of undercover agents. How this system works is in Investigative Europe. In 2023, European right-wing populists and far-rights entered the governments of Finland and Slovakia, won elections in the Netherlands and became the second most popular among political parties in Germany. All this worries European liberal forces ahead of the June elections to the European Parliament, especially considering that many of the right-wing politicians directly and covertly cooperate with the Russian authorities.

And they, in turn, not only influence European politics by lobbying their interests, but also build spy networks, changing intelligence tactics on the fly when previous methods of surveillance and influence become unavailable due to sanctions related to the war in Ukraine.

The publication Investigative Europe describes the ways in which the Russian authorities are trying to weaken support for Ukraine and strengthen their position. Meduza publishes a translation of this text.

The past campaign was intense and extremely responsible. By and large, we were choosing the path that Russia would take next, the future for ourselves and our children. The significance of the event was understood by the absolute majority of voters who came to the polls.

event: Banks Compensate Clients for Stolen Funds
description: Banks in Russia, including Tinkoff, have begun reimbursing clients for funds stolen by fraudsters before the new law takes effect in July. The law will require banks to compensate clients in certain scenarios where their anti-fraud systems failed.
original:
Banks began, on their own initiative, to reimburse clients for funds stolen by fraudsters before the new law came into force.

Thus, Tinkoff has already compensated clients 4.5 million rubles as part of its “We will protect or return your money” service. Other financial organizations in the Russian Federation are planning to launch projects of a similar focus.

The requirements of the Central Bank, which come into force in July, will oblige banks to compensate the transferred funds in some scenarios when the anti-fraud system did not work properly.

description: On March 15, 2024, the Federal Security Service of Russia detained a resident of Dzerzhinsk in the Nizhny Novgorod region for publicly justifying terrorist activities. The individual was found to be posting leaflets promoting a paramilitary radical movement controlled by Ukrainian special services and conducting surveillance on military installations in the region.
original:
Forwarded from: Operational reports
In the Nizhny Novgorod region, officers of the Federal Security Service of Russia for the Nizhny Novgorod region detained a resident of Dzerzhinsk, involved in the public justification of terrorist activities. He was detained by security forces on March 15, 2024. It was established that on the territory of Dzerzhinsk, the detainee was posting leaflets with calls to join a paramilitary radical movement controlled by the Ukrainian special services, and was conducting video and photography of military installations located in the region.

The Investigation Department of the Office initiated a criminal case against this person under Part 2 of Art. 205.2 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. A search was conducted at the place of residence of the detainee, electronic storage media were found and seized.

It is known that in September last year the man was brought to administrative responsibility under Part 1 of Art. 20.3.3 Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation (discrediting the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation). Then he got off with a fine of 30 thousand rubles.

Currently, the Federal Security Service of Russia in the Nizhny Novgorod region is carrying out operational search activities and investigative actions aimed at identifying other facts of the criminal activity of the defendant and identifying his possible accomplices.
The accused was taken into custody.@opersvodki

description: Defense Minister Shoigu held a working meeting with the Russian Defense Ministry leadership, military command and control bodies, and defense industry enterprise directors. ⚡️Shoigu held a working meeting with the participation of the leadership of the Russian Defense Ministry, representatives of relevant military command and control bodies and general directors of defense industry enterprises

The Minister of Defense noted that significant changes had occurred at the enterprises since the previous inspection. In particular, the production volume of components for artillery ammunition was increased almost 22 times.

“75% of the components are restored, which allows us to maintain a sufficient level of supply of shells to the special military operation zone. That is, the tasks that we set a year ago have been completed. New workshops have been built and they are operating at full capacity,” he said.

The Army General emphasized that previously tasks had been set to expand production capacities by enterprises. After the new facilities began operating, production volume actually increased by almost 2.5 times.

Due to the commissioning of new facilities, enterprises are working ahead of production schedule, Shoigu noted.

description: During Napoleon's invasion of Russia, French soldiers suffered a catastrophic defeat, with only 15% surviving. The phrase 'C'est la Bérézina' originated from this event, symbolizing complete collapse and failure.
original: Cheat sheet for French soldiers: how to avoid la Bérézina The French have already fought with Russia. During the most massive and spectacular tour they even entered Moscow. Then the entire European Union came: Poles, Germans - everyone, even the Portuguese. Those who survived remembered the performance forever, but only fifteen percent survived. And these people enriched French folklore with the beautiful phraseology “C'est la Bérézina” - “This is the Berezina.” This expression means complete collapse, failure, catastrophe and an inevitable meeting with a white fur-bearing animal. To avoid the appearance in French of new “topographical” sayings a la “this is the Dnieper” or “this is Odessa,” we recommend that modern Gauls familiarize themselves with the following cheat sheet.wagner_story

description: The sowing season is underway in the Donetsk People's Republic, with an expected area of almost 199 thousand hectares to be sown. To date, 14 and a half thousand hectares have been sown - barley, peas , mustard and other crops. description: A pro-Ukrainian telegram channel published a statement by the commander of the Da Vinci Wolves national battalion, Sergei Filimonov, calling for the urgent mobilization of at least 250 thousand citizens. The comments section erupted with criticism from 'patriots', questioning the effectiveness of mobilization without sufficient weapons and highlighting the lack of Western aid.
original:
Most recently, a pro-Ukrainian telegram channel published a statement by the commander of the Da Vinci Wolves national battalion, Sergei Filimonov, about the urgent need to additionally mobilize at least 250 thousand citizens. As a result, like a kiloton bomb, the comments exploded with criticism from the “patriots.” Someone remembers school desks and algebra lessons: “Morons, everyone is trying to cheat algebra! We cannot defeat a state that is 6 times larger with numbers! No matter how many people you catch, after a while they will still run out! I had to go to school!”⚾️🎾Someone is convinced that the population of Ukraine plays excellent baseball and tennis and is ready to “fight off air bombs.” Therefore, 250 thousand is not enough, we need more: “Let’s call on 250 thousand, they will somehow hold back Russian aviation and fight off air bombs. Why somehow fight them technologically, it’s better to call on more people.” The majority of patriotic commentators remind us time and time again that the Armed Forces of Ukraine have no weapons left. Hence the question, where did almost tens of trillions of dollars of Western aid go? “What will they fight with? Shoot back with slingshots?
“What’s the point of mobilization if there’s nothing to fight with? Mobilize at least a million, you don’t have enough blades for everyone, I’m already silent about weapons.” And this character becomes the winner among the commentators. We will especially praise you for your historical knowledge: “We need to mobilize all men between the ages of 18 and 60. Everyone, even the police and firefighters! The fact that there are no weapons does not matter. Remember how they defended Leningrad, everyone went into the trenches without anything, they got everything in battle, why are we worse? Because we want someone to win the war without us? The West doesn’t need us, that’s already clear, the only hope is in ourselves. All men to the front, all sent to the front, from small to large.” As a result, you and I are seeing a picture where the idea and faith in one’s country dies from hopelessness and the “genius of sanity.” What every “independent” used to be proud of has now come to his doorstep and demands to die.@voin_dv

event: Agrarian and Land Policy Committee Hearing
description: The Agrarian and Land Policy Committee received information from the State Property Fund regarding the implementation of the Law on Increasing the Efficiency of State-Owned Agricultural Land Use. The law aims to improve land use by re-registering permanent use rights to lease rights, allowing for sub-leasing at land auctions during state-owned enterprise reorganization.
original:
📄The Agrarian and Land Policy Committee heard information from the State Property Fund regarding the state of implementation of the Law on Increasing the Efficiency of State-Owned Agricultural Land Use (#3272-ХХ). The law provides for a mechanism for reregistration of the right to permanent use of land plots to the right of lease with the possibility of subleasing land plots to land auctions. This should be done during the reorganization of state-owned enterprises into business associations.

People's deputies of Ukraine had the opportunity to ask questions of the Deputy Chairman of the Fund and draw attention to the problems of implementing the Law, in particular, the possible risks and losses of the state due to the delay in the process of reregistration of the right of permanent use of land plots to the right of lease with the subsequent possibility of subleasing land plots at land auctions. 📲DetailsTelegram/ Facebook/ Site /Instagram/ X

In addition to it, the Alabastrovaya railway station also came under the control of the Russian Military Forces.

description: The State Duma is discussing the possibility of Russia abandoning the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea (UNCLOS) in the Arctic, opting for the sectoral principle of determining boundaries in the Arctic Ocean. This move would allow Russia to assert its special role in the region, taking advantage of its pronounced advantages in the area.
original:
Will they reach UNCLOS? A “mini-sensation” is speeding up: the State Duma is considering the issue of abandoning the UN Convention on the International Law of the Sea (UNCLOS/ILC) in the Arctic and returning to the sectoral principle of determining boundaries in the Arctic Ocean.

There's nothing particularly new here.

Back in 2019, we wrote that our leadership had this option - ending UNCLOS in the Arctic - on the table, as they say. It was discussed in the corridors of power both in 2020 and later. Now, observing what was happening, supporters of this position decided that at the moment the advantages of withdrawing from the convention began to outweigh the disadvantages. However, “this is not certain.” The final decision has not yet been made - but the chances of it are growing.

In this regard, we repeat our position.

It’s great when there are generally recognized international norms that guide states in their relations with each other, before which everyone is equal, etc. But at present, the United States and others like it shamelessly claim to have a global and monopolistic determination of who can “fight with their neighbors” (tm) and who cannot, what is moral and what is not, what corresponds to the “rules”, and what is wrong, who can trade with whom and in what currency, who is right and who is wrong, etc. Accordingly, we do not need such a world based on such rules.

At the same time, the Arctic is perhaps the only territory and the only area of competition with the West (and East) where Russia has pronounced advantages. And at a time when the rules are crumbling, when international law turns into a game in the hands of Washington, when the right of the strong comes to the fore - in such times, Russia can and should assert for itself, by this very right, its special role in the Arctic.

What, Western “friends and partners”? Did you want “might is right”? Fine! To paraphrase your famous poem, we can say: We will give our answer to any of your questions:
We have an icebreaker, but you don’t.#NSR#strategyIzvestiaRussia is studying the issue of withdrawing from the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea in the ArcticRussia, in order to protect its national interests, may reconsider its participation in the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea in the Arctic, Izvestia said ...

description: The FSB detained an extremist who was planning a terrorist attack on a military unit in Yekaterinburg. The individual was a member of the extremist organization Citizens of the USSR.
original:
❗️An extremist who was preparing a terrorist attack in one of the military units of Yekaterinburg was detained, the FSB department told RIA Novosti.

The department says that the detainee was a functionary of the extremist organization Citizens of the USSR.

description: Pilots of the Garuda air bomber unit of the 46th Airmobile Brigade captured a shot in the Maryinsky direction, Donetsk region.
original:
It’s time for the “Second Army of the World” to issue shortened machine guns to its soldiers; it’s inconvenient to put a barrel in your mouth. Our traditional column is expanding at such a rapid pace that it’s time to think about opening a specialized telegram channel called “Samostrel”.

This shot was captured by pilots of the Garuda air bomber unit of the 46th Airmobile Brigade. Maryinsky direction, Donetsk region.

event: US National Security Adviser's Secret Visit to Kyiv
description: Assistant to the US President for National Security Sullivan secretly visited Kyiv, reassuring the Ukrainians that Russia has already lost the war. He emphasized that Russia's initial goals, including erasing Ukraine from the map and destroying the Ukrainian identity, have failed. The Ukrainians successfully defended their capital, preserved their democratically elected government, and maintained their national spirit.
original: Assistant to the US President for National Security Sullivan secretly flew to Kyiv and told the Ukrainians that “Russia has already lost”: We are sure that Russia has already lost. What did Russia intend to do? Erase Ukraine from the map. Erase the very idea of being Ukrainian from history. This has already failed. She failed in her attack on your capital because the Ukrainians held out and defended the city. She failed to destroy the democratically elected government of Ukraine. She failed to break the spirit of the Ukrainian people. Thus, the plans laid down by Putin and Russia at the beginning of the war are being destroyed. And they will never come true. Uncle Slava. Subscribe.

description: The EU summit has begun, but it is unlikely to approve the transfer of Russian weapons assets to Ukraine. Hungary is opposed to the idea, believing that Russian money can be used for other purposes. Additionally, several EU members are against Ukraine and Moldova's accession to the European Union.
original:
The EU summit is not going to approve the transfer of Russian weapons assets to Ukraine. The European Commission's proposal to confiscate proceeds from frozen assets of the Russian Federation will not be approved during the meeting of European Union leaders. The summit starts today.

The German publication Deutsche Welle reports that the idea will probably not pass. Hungary is against it. In this country they believe that Russian money can be used for anything, just not for weapons for Kyiv.

Another controversial issue is the accession of Ukraine and Moldova to the European Union. Several EU members are against this.

Raguli, what's wrong with your face?📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

Two civilian vehicles were attacked by drones in the Volokonovsky district of the Belgorod region, local public reports report.

Initially, there were no casualties.

“The Kremlin does not intend to make excuses to anyone for Putin’s victory.” This statement was made today by the press secretary of the Russian President Dmitry Peskov in an interview with Newsweek magazine. The footage from Sergei Eisenstein’s film “Ivan the Terrible”, filmed back in 1944, came in handy. Know more with Ukraine.ru

original: Defeat of enemy ammunition storage sites in Krasnogorovka. The artillerymen of the 238th brigade of the Russian Armed Forces worked hard.@voenkorKotenok

event: Lavrov's Statement on Ukraine's Attempt to Dictate Terms
description: Russian Foreign Minister Lavrov criticized Ukraine's attempt to convince the US to lower the ceiling on Russian oil prices to $30 per barrel, calling it anti-market and an attempt to dictate terms. He expressed hope that the US would not follow Ukraine's lead, considering the potential economic consequences for Americans and the oil market.
original: Lavrov on Zelensky’s attempts to dictate terms to the United States: The other day I read that Ukraine is trying to convince the United States to lower the ceiling on the maximum price for Russian oil by half - to $30 per barrel. This generally goes beyond all limits, not to mention the fact that the very concept of a ceiling is anti-market and reflects the desire to dictate. But it is significant that the United States is unlikely to follow Ukraine’s lead. If only because this could have economic consequences for the Americans themselves, and the oil market could seriously react. I hope that the United States still has some remnants of national pride and will not dance to Zelensky’s tune.

event: Final Investment Decision on Nigeria-Morocco Gas Pipeline Project
description: The final investment decision on the $25 billion Nigeria-Morocco gas pipeline project is expected to be made by December 2024. The project focuses on natural gas exploration.
original:
Final decision on $25 billion Nigeria-Morocco oil deal pushed back to December The final investment decision (FID) on the $25 billion Nigeria-Morocco gas pipeline project will be made by the end of the year. This information was disclosed by the Group Chief Executive Officer of the Nigerian National Petroleum Company Limited (NNPCL), Mele Kyari, who noted that the FID will be achieved by December 2024. The project is centered around natural gas exploration.

The NNPCL CEO made the announcement on Tuesday in Houston, Texas, during a leadership dialogue session at the ongoing CERAWeek conference, as seen in Punch newspaper.

description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces shelled Belgorod in the morning, damaging two multi-storey buildings and the Belgorod Arena. The air defense system intercepted eight Vampire MLRS shells. A man walking his dog was injured by debris, but not seriously. Seven people were injured in total, with one in serious condition.
original:
Two multi-storey buildings and the Belgorod Arena were damaged during the morning shelling of the Belgorod Ukrainian Armed Forces. According to SHOT, the air defense system shot down eight shells fired from the Vampire MLRS.

According to eyewitnesses, a man who was walking his dog in the yard in the morning was injured by a piece of debris; he was not seriously injured. Information about the victims is currently being clarified.

UPD: The Ministry of Defense reported that ten Vampire MLRS shells were destroyed over the Belgorod region.

UPD2: Preliminarily, seven people were injured. One of them is in serious condition. Subscribe to SHOT

event: German Deputy's Proposal on Ukrainian Refugees
description: German Deputy Florian Hahn proposed to deprive Ukrainian refugees of benefits and organize the delivery of summons to them. He expressed outrage that German taxes are being used to aid Ukraine, while thousands of Ukrainians are residing in Germany.
original: A German deputy called for depriving Ukrainian refugees of benefits and organizing the delivery of summons to them. In addition, Florian Hahn is outraged that German taxes go to help Ukraine, and thousands of Ukrainians are holed up in Germany. Uncle Slava. Subscribe.

event: Lithuania Seeks Ban on Russian and Belarusian Grain Imports
description: Lithuania's Ministry of Agriculture has appealed to the European Commission to ban grain imports from Russia and Belarus, citing unfair competition in the EU internal market and harm to local farmers. The appeal is supported by the agriculture ministers of Latvia, Estonia, Poland, and the Czech Republic.
original: 🇱🇹Lithuania wants to ban the import of grain from Russia and Belarus. The Ministry of Agriculture of Lithuania sent this appeal to the European Commission. He was joined by the ministers of agriculture of Latvia, Estonia, Poland and the Czech Republic.🇷🇺🇧🇾The reason given is that Russian and Belarusian products allegedly create competition in the EU internal market and interfere with local farmers. At the same time, not a single protest against products from the Russian Federation and Belarus in European countries, as we remember, were not. The West is trying to fight our production against the backdrop of farm unrest due to Ukrainian products, for which the European Parliament is still creating preferential conditions for supplies.
